Now, RT alone. For nasal cavity and vestibule SCC, outcomes with RT can vary. Local control rates might be lower compared to combined modality, especially in T3. Survival in stage IVA (T3N0M0) with RT alone. If the tumor was unresectable and treated with RT, 5-year survival rates might be around 40-50%, but this varies. However, considering his age, the 5-year survival probability decreases. Elderly patients often have comorbidities and may not tolerate salvage treatments if recurrence occurs. Putting it all together, even though he's ECOG 1, the combination of advanced T stage, age, and smoking history likely leads to a poorer prognosis.
